text: Zeleke Y (2026). rtimecapsule: Automatic Backup R Scripts, Rmd, Quarto Files. R package version 0.1.0, https://github.com/yihun/rtimecapsule.
code: @Manual{,   title = {rtimecapsule: Automatic Backup for R Scripts, Rmd, and Quarto Files},   author = {Yihun Zeleke},   year = {2026},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://github.com/yihun/rtimecapsule}, }

title: Automatic Backup for R Scripts, Rmd, and Quarto Files
text: rtimecapsule package provides automated, real-time backup restoration capabilities R project files. continuously monitors files changes maintains backup copies hidden .rtimecapsule directory, allowing recover crashes, accidental deletions, unwanted modifications.

title: Automatic Backup for R Scripts, Rmd, and Quarto Files
text: Automatic Background Backups: Background execution implemented using scheduled callbacks create separate system processes. Selective File Tracking: Choose files file types backup Quick Restoration: Restore individual files entire project instantly Status Monitoring: Check backup status tracked files time Auto-Start Support: Configure automatic backup project load Lightweight: Minimal performance impact configurable scan intervals

title: Automatic Backup for R Scripts, Rmd, and Quarto Files
code: # Install from GitHub (replace USERNAME with actual GitHub username) # install.packages("remotes") remotes::install_github("yihun/rtimecapsule")

title: Automatic Backup for R Scripts, Rmd, and Quarto Files
code: library(rtimecapsule)  # Start automatic backups for all R files start_autobackup(interval = 2, files = ".R")  # Check status capsule_status()  # Restore a specific file restore_file("R/analysis.R")  # Restore files from the most recent backup restore_last_crash()  # Stop backups stop_autobackup()

title: Automatic Backup for R Scripts, Rmd, and Quarto Files
text: Start automatic file backups background. function monitors project files creates backups whenever changes detected. Arguments: - interval: Number seconds file checks (default: 2) - files: files track: - NULL (default): Track files project - ".R": Track R scripts - c("script1.R", "report.Rmd", "dashboard.qmd"): Track specific files Details: function runs non-blocking background task using later package. : 1. Scans tracked files specified interval 2. Computes file hashes detect changes 3. Creates backups .rtimecapsule/ files change 4. Continues running stop_autobackup() called Examples:
code: # Monitor all files, check every 2 seconds start_autobackup()

title: Automatic Backup for R Scripts, Rmd, and Quarto Files
text: Stop automatic backup process. Examples:
code: # Stop backups when you're done working stop_autobackup()

title: Automatic Backup for R Scripts, Rmd, and Quarto Files
text: Enable automatic startup backups open project. adds startup hook project’s .Rprofile file. ensures backups start automatically whenever open project interactive R session. Examples:
code: # Set up auto-start (run once per project) use_autobackup()  # Now backups will start automatically when you open the project

title: Automatic Backup for R Scripts, Rmd, and Quarto Files
text: Display current status rtimecapsule, including whether backups running, many files tracked, many backups exist. Returns: list three elements: - running: Logical indicating auto-backup active - tracked_files: Number files currently tracked - backup_files: Number backup files .rtimecapsule/ Examples:
code: # Check status status <- capsule_status() print(status) #> $running #> [1] TRUE #>  #> $tracked_files #> [1] 15 #>  #> $backup_files #> [1] 12

title: Automatic Backup for R Scripts, Rmd, and Quarto Files
text: Restore single file backup original location. Arguments: - file: File path relative project root Details: function: 1. Locates project root directory 2. Searches backup file .rtimecapsule/ 3. Creates necessary parent directories 4. Copies backup file target location, overwriting exists Returns: Returns TRUE invisibly success. Errors: Throws error backup exists specified file. Examples:
code: # Restore a single R script restore_file("R/analysis.R")  # Restore a file in a subdirectory restore_file("scripts/preprocessing/clean_data.R")

title: Automatic Backup for R Scripts, Rmd, and Quarto Files
text: Restore files last backup. Useful recovering system crashes reverting major changes. Details: function performs complete restoration: 1. Locates project root directory 2. Checks existence .rtimecapsule/ backup directory 3. Recursively lists backup files 4. Restores file original location, maintaining directory structure 5. Overwrites existing files backup versions Returns: Returns TRUE invisibly success. Errors: Throws error .rtimecapsule backup directory exists. Examples:
code: # Restore all backed up files after a crash restore_last_crash()

title: Automatic Backup for R Scripts, Rmd, and Quarto Files
text: rtimecapsule maintains hidden .rtimecapsule directory mirrors project structure:
code: your-project/ ├── .rtimecapsule/          # Hidden backup directory │   ├── R/ │   │   ├── analysis.R      # Backed up version │   │   └── utils.R │   ├── data/ │   │   └── dataset.csv │   └── scripts/ │       └── preprocess.R ├── R/                      # Your working files │   ├── analysis.R          # Current version │   └── utils.R ├── .Rprofile               # Optional: auto-start configuration └── ...

title: Automatic Backup for R Scripts, Rmd, and Quarto Files
code: library(rtimecapsule)  # Enable auto-start (one-time setup) use_autobackup()  # Start backups for this session start_autobackup(interval = 2)

title: Automatic Backup for R Scripts, Rmd, and Quarto Files
code: # Backups run automatically in the background # Check status occasionally capsule_status()  # If you need to restore a file you accidentally changed restore_file("R/analysis.R")  # Stop backups when done for the day (optional) stop_autobackup()

title: Automatic Backup for R Scripts, Rmd, and Quarto Files
code: # After R crashes and you restart library(rtimecapsule) restore_last_crash() # Your work is recovered!

title: Automatic Backup for R Scripts, Rmd, and Quarto Files
code: # Ensure backups are running start_autobackup(interval = 1)  # More frequent checks  # Do your refactoring...  # If something goes wrong restore_last_crash()

title: Automatic Backup for R Scripts, Rmd, and Quarto Files
code: # List all backed up files backup_files <- list.files(".rtimecapsule", recursive = TRUE) print(backup_files)  # Restore only specific files restore_file("R/core_functions.R") restore_file("R/analysis.R")  # Or restore everything restore_last_crash()

title: Automatic Backup for R Scripts, Rmd, and Quarto Files
text: Start backups early: Run start_autobackup() beginning session Use auto-start: Set use_autobackup() never forget Active development: 1-2 seconds Normal work: 2-5 seconds Light monitoring: 5-10 seconds selective files: track files ’re actively editing Check status regularly: Use capsule_status() ensure backups running Combine version control: Use rtimecapsule real-time protection, Git milestones Test restoration: Try restore_file() non-critical file understand workflow

title: Automatic Backup for R Scripts, Rmd, and Quarto Files
text: Track source code files (.R, .Rmd, .qmd) best performance Use 2-3 second intervals typical projects Exclude large data files binary outputs

title: Automatic Backup for R Scripts, Rmd, and Quarto Files
text: Problem: start_autobackup() doesn’t seem work Solutions:
code: # Check if 'later' package is installed if (!requireNamespace("later", quietly = TRUE)) {   install.packages("later") }  # Verify backups are running capsule_status()$running  # Check for error messages start_autobackup()

title: Automatic Backup for R Scripts, Rmd, and Quarto Files
text: want preserve global startup settings enable rtimecapsule per project, add following project-level .Rprofile:
code: # Source global R profile if it exists if (file.exists("~/.Rprofile")) {   source("~/.Rprofile") }  # Start rtimecapsule automatically (interactive sessions only) if (interactive()) {   rtimecapsule::start_autobackup() }

title: Automatic Backup for R Scripts, Rmd, and Quarto Files
text: Problem: restore_last_crash() reports “backups found” Solutions:
code: # Check if backup directory exists dir.exists(".rtimecapsule")  # Verify backups are being created start_autobackup() # Make a change to a file # Wait a few seconds capsule_status()$backup_files  # Should be > 0

title: Automatic Backup for R Scripts, Rmd, and Quarto Files
text: Problem: restore_file() fails Solutions:
code: # Verify the backup exists list.files(".rtimecapsule", recursive = TRUE)  # Check file path is relative to project root # Correct: "R/analysis.R" # Wrong: "/absolute/path/analysis.R"  # Ensure you're in the project directory getwd()

title: Automatic Backup for R Scripts, Rmd, and Quarto Files
text: later: Required background task scheduling Project root detection: Uses project_root() helper function File tracking: Uses tracked_files() helper function Hashing: Uses file_hash() change detection

what: Backup a file to .rtimecapsule folder — backup_file
title: Backup a file to .rtimecapsule folder — backup_file
text: Backup file .rtimecapsule folder

title: Backup a file to .rtimecapsule folder — backup_file
code: backup_file(file, root = project_root())

title: Backup a file to .rtimecapsule folder — backup_file
text: file File path back root Project root path (default: detected automatically)

title: Backup a file to .rtimecapsule folder — backup_file
text: NULL (invisibly)

title: Backup a file to .rtimecapsule folder — backup_file
code: # Create a temporary file to demonstrate backup tmp <- tempfile(fileext = ".R") writeLines("print('hello world')", tmp)  # Backup the temporary file if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ backup_file(tmp, root = tempdir()) } # }  # Clean up unlink(tmp)

text: List backups file

title: Start rtimecapsule auto-backup (non-blocking) — start_autobackup
text: Runs background task mirrors selected files .rtimecapsule folder whenever change.

code: start_autobackup(interval = 2, files = NULL)

text: interval Seconds checks files NULL (default), file extension (e.g. ".R"), character vector file names

text: Invisibly TRUE

title: rtimecapsule 0.1.0
text: Initial CRAN submission. Automatically backs R, R Markdown, Quarto files R projects. Non-blocking background backup using timed polling. Restore files accidental deletion crashes.
